benchmark_details.name: CARES (Comprehensive Evaluation of Trustworthiness in Medical Vision Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: CARES is a benchmark designed to evaluate the trustworthiness of Medical Large Vision Language Models (Med-LVLMs) across five dimensions: trustfulness, fairness, safety, privacy, and robustness. It comprises about 41K question-answer pairs covering 16 medical image modalities and 27 anatomical regions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of trustworthiness in Med-LVLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: CARES does not cover all medical image modalities or anatomical sites due to limitations in existing open-source medical data.

data.source: Curated from seven medical multimodal and image classification datasets.
data.format: Various formats including closed and open-ended questions
data.annotation: Constructed using templates and transformations of medical reports and existing datasets.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using the model outputs compared to ground truth responses.
methodology.interpretation: Evaluations highlight disparities in model performance across demographic groups and assess the reliability of model responses in clinical contexts.
methodology.baseline_results: Existing models exhibit low performance across various metrics, highlighting significant concerns regarding their trustworthiness.
methodology.validation: Evaluated based on accuracy and utility in clinical settings.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Disparities in model performance were observed based on age, gender, and race metrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Current Med-LVLMs show significant gaps in privacy protection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The specific licensing of the datasets used is not disclosed.
